Query Module¶

Query Module

class Anilist.query.Query(client: Client, head_nama, head_namb, defa)¶

An interface to make Queries to the Anilist API This should usually not be used, instead use one of the subclasses

Warning

This usually should not be created manually

Parameters:

  • client (Client) – A QueryClient to make requests

  • head_nama (str) – Name of the head Scheme when in a Page object

  • head_namb (str) – Name of the head Scheme when in a Query object

  • defa (list[Scheme]) – List of default Schemes

Example:

client = Anilist.QueryClient()
schs = Scheme().Media(type="$type", search="$search").sub_schemes(
    Scheme().id,
    Scheme().title.english
)
vars = Vars(type=AnilistMediaType("ANIME"), search="One Piece")
result = client._request(client._create_query(vars, *schs), vars)

# This is equivalent to using the following shortcut:
media_search = Anilist.QueryClient().media_entry()
media_search.search(
    Scheme().id,
    Scheme().title.english,

    type=AnilistMediaType("ANIME"),
    search="One Piece"
)
result = media_search.results_take_one()
results_take_all()¶

Returns the whole result tray and empties it

results_take_back()¶

Returns the last element of the Query Result and removes it from the Query Result

Raises:

KeyError – If the Query Result is empty

Returns:

Last element of the query’s results tray

Return type:

AnilistObject

results_take_front()¶

Returns the first element of the result tray and removes it from the tray.

Raises:

KeyError – If the Query Result is empty

Returns:

First element of the query’s results tray

Return type:

AnilistObject

search(*schs: Scheme, default=True, per_page: int = 100, page: int = 1, paginate=False, **kwargs)¶

Send a query to the Anilist API and add the results to the result tray

Parameters:

schs (tuple[Scheme]) – The Schemes to search for, they will be appended to the specific Query object’s head Scheme

Keyword Args:

Parameters:

  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to add the specific Query object’s default Schemes (the default is True)

  • paginate (bool, optional) – Whether to request a single element or pages of the element, if set to True then several results will be added to the result tray (the default is False)

  • per_page (int, optional) – The number of objects to query per page, this is useless if paginate is set to False (the default is 100)

  • page (int, optional) – The page to start on (the default is 1)

**kwargs:

The kwargs pairs are all used to create the search query, they are added as arguments to the specific Query object’s head Scheme

For example if you are using a MediaEntryQuery:

# ... get a MediaEntryQuery
media_search = ... # media_search is a MediaEntryQuery

media_search.search(
    # Search schemes
    Scheme().id
    Scheme().status
    Scheme().episodes

    # Search parameters
    default=True
    paginate=True
    per_page=50
    page=1

    # Search arguments
    type=AnilistMediaType("ANIME")
    search="One Piece"
)

# This generates the following query and variables:
#
# Query:
#
# query (
#   $type: MediaType, 
#   $search: String, 
#   $perPage: Int, 
#   $page: Int
# ) {
#   Page (page: $page, perPage: $perPage) {
#       media (type: $type, search: $search) {
#           id
#           status
#           episodes
#       }
#    }
# }
#
# Variables:
#
# {
#   "search": "One Piece", 
#   "type": "ANIME", 
#   "perPage" 50, 
#   "page": 1
# }
class Anilist.query.MediaListQuery(client: Client, languages=['english'], sizes=['extraLarge'])¶

An interface for making Queries for media lists to the Anilist API

Warning

This usually should not be created manually, instead use QueryClient.media_list()

Returns the whole result tray and empties it

class Anilist.query.MediaEntryQuery(client: Client, languages=['english'], sizes=['extraLarge'])¶

An interface for making Queries for media to the Anilist API

Warning

This usually should not be created manually, instead use QueryClient.media_entry()

search(*schs: Scheme, default=True, per_page: int = 100, page: int = 1, paginate=False, **kwargs)¶

Send a query to the Anilist API and add the results to the result tray

Parameters:

schs (tuple[Scheme]) – The Schemes to search for, they will be appended to the specific Query object’s head Scheme

Keyword Args:

Parameters:

  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to add the specific Query object’s default Schemes (the default is True)

  • paginate (bool, optional) – Whether to request a single element or pages of the element, if set to True then several results will be added to the result tray (the default is False)

  • per_page (int, optional) – The number of objects to query per page, this is useless if paginate is set to False (the default is 100)

  • page (int, optional) – The page to start on (the default is 1)

**kwargs:

The kwargs pairs are all used to create the search query, they are added as arguments to the specific Query object’s head Scheme

For example if you are using a MediaEntryQuery:

# ... get a MediaEntryQuery
media_search = ... # media_search is a MediaEntryQuery

media_search.search(
    # Search schemes
    Scheme().id
    Scheme().status
    Scheme().episodes

    # Search parameters
    default=True
    paginate=True
    per_page=50
    page=1

    # Search arguments
    type=AnilistMediaType("ANIME")
    search="One Piece"
)

# This generates the following query and variables:
#
# Query:
#
# query (
#   $type: MediaType, 
#   $search: String, 
#   $perPage: Int, 
#   $page: Int
# ) {
#   Page (page: $page, perPage: $perPage) {
#       media (type: $type, search: $search) {
#           id
#           status
#           episodes

#    }
# }
#
# Variables:

# {
#   "search": "One Piece",

#   "page": 1
